ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
O human being, what has deceived you concerning your Generous Lord (Rabb) when the doors were closed and the curtains were lowered and you concealed yourself from the creatures, so you committed immorality? So what will you do when your limbs have testified against you? So woe, all woe to us, the community of the heedless ones (al-ghÄfilÄ«n). Allah sends to us the master of the messengers and reveals to him the Clear Book (al-KitÄb al-MubÄ«n) and informs us of these attributes from the descriptions of the Day of Recompense (Yawm al-DÄ«n). Then He makes us aware of our heedlessness (ghafla) and says: 'The reckoning for the people has drawn near, while they are in heedlessness (ghafla), turning away.' Then He makes us aware of the nearness of the Hour (al-SÄÊ¿a) and says: 'The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split. Indeed, they see it as distant, but We see it as near.' 'And what will make you know? Perhaps the Hour is near.' Then the best of our states is that we take the study of this Qur'an as an action, so we do not ponder its meanings, nor do we look at the multitude of descriptions and names of this Day, nor do we prepare to escape from its calamities. So we seek refuge in Allah from this heedlessness (ghafla) if Allah does not reach us with His vast mercy.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
Do you not contemplate His saying, the Exalted: 'The accounting of the people has drawn near while they are in heedlessness, turning away. No new Remembrance (Dhikr) comes to them from their Lord except they listen to it while they play, their Hearts (Qalb) distracted.' And woe to you, O Soul (Nafs)! If your boldness in disobeying Allah is due to your belief that Allah does not see you, then how great is your disbelief (Kufr)! And if it is with your knowledge of His awareness of you, then how severe is your insolence and how little your shame! Woe to you, O Soul (Nafs)! If a slave from your slaves, or rather a brother from your brothers, confronted you with what you dislike, how would your anger be upon him and your hatred for him? So with what audacity do you expose yourself to the hatred of Allah, His anger, and His severe punishment? Do you think you can bear His punishment? Far from it, far from it! Test yourself: if heedlessness distracts you from His painful punishment, then confine yourself for an hour in the sun, or in the bathhouse, or bring your finger near the fire to make clear the extent of your capacity. Are you deluded by the generosity of Allah and His bounty and His independence from your obedience and worship? So why do you not rely on the generosity of Allah, the Exalted, in the affairs of your worldly life? If an enemy intends you, why do you not devise means to repel him, nor entrust him to the generosity of Allah, the Exalted? And if a need for a desire from the desires of the worldly life, which does not end except with the dinar and dirham, overwhelms you, why do you exert the Spirit (Ruh) in seeking it and obtaining it through various means, not relying on the generosity of Allah, the Exalted, until He causes you to stumble upon a treasure or subjugates a slave from His slaves to carry your need to you without effort or seeking from you? Do you reckon that Allah is generous in the Hereafter but not in the worldly life? And you have known that the way of Allah has no change, and that the Lord of the Hereafter and the worldly life is One (Tawhid).

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Etiquette of Quran Recitation
And he was included in the meaning of His Mighty and Majestic saying: 'And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Book except [mere] wishes' meaning mere recitation, and His Mighty and Majestic saying: 'And how many a sign in the heavens and earth they pass over while they are turning away from it' because the Quran is the clarifier of those signs in the heavens and the earth, and whenever he passes over them and is not affected by them, he is turning away from them. Therefore, it is said: Indeed, whoever is not characterized by the morals of the Quran, then when he recites the Quran, Allah the Exalted calls to him: What is your affair with My speech while you are turning away from Me? Leave My speech if you do not repent to Me. And the example of the disobedient one when he recites the Quran and repeats it is like one who repeats the book of the king every day multiple times, while it has been written to him concerning the building of his kingdom, yet he is busy destroying it and restricts himself to studying his book. Perhaps if he left the study at the time of transgression, he would be farther from mockery and deserving of hatred. Therefore, Yusuf ibn Asbat said: Indeed, I intend to recite the Quran, but when I remember what is in it, I fear hatred, so I turn to glorification and seeking forgiveness. And the one turning away from acting upon it is intended by His Mighty and Majestic saying: 'So they threw it behind their backs and purchased with it a small price, so wretched...'

a.g: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"
The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."
Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?
And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

If you say: Indeed Allah the Exalted has said: 'So ask the people of the Remembrance (Dhikr) if you do not know' (16:43). So asking is commanded. Know that it is indeed so, but only regarding what the teacher permits you to ask about. For asking about what your rank has not reached to understand is blameworthy. And for that reason, Al-Khidr prevented Moses, peace be upon them, from askingâ€”meaning, leave the question before its proper time. For the teacher knows better what you are worthy of and the time of unveiling (Kashf). And what has not entered the time of unveiling in every degree of the ascending degrees, does not enter the time of questioning about it.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
And the greatest blessing of Allah upon His servants is knowledge and the unveiling of truth, and faith is an expression of a type of unveiling and knowledge. Therefore, Allah said, as a favor upon His servant: 'And great is the favor of Allah upon you' (Quran 4:113), and He intended by it knowledge. ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
The Seventh Foundation: That He, the Exalted, does with His servants what He wills, so it is not obligatory upon Him to observe what is most beneficial for His servants, due to what we have mentioned that nothing is obligatory upon Him, the Glorified, rather obligation is inconceivable in His regard. For He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned. And I wonder how the Mu'tazilite would answer in his claim that what is most beneficial is obligatory upon Him in a matter we present to him, which is to suppose a debate in the Hereafter between a child and an adult who both died as Muslims. For Allah, the Glorified, increases the degrees of the adult and favors him over the child because he toiled in faith and acts of obedience after puberty, and this is obligatory upon Him according to the Mu'tazilite. So if the child says: 'O Lord, why have You elevated his station above mine?' He would say: 'Because he reached puberty and strove in acts of obedience.' And the child says: 'You caused me to die in childhood, so it was obligatory upon You to prolong my life until I reached puberty so I could strive.' You have deviated from justice in favoring him with long life to my exclusion, so why have You favored him? Allah, the Exalted, says: 'Because I knew that if you had reached puberty, you would have associated partners or disobeyed, so what was most beneficial for you was death in childhood.' This is the Mu'tazilite's excuse for Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. And at this, the disbelievers call from the depths of Hellfire and say: 'O Lord, did You not know that if we had reached puberty we would have associated partners? Why did You not cause us to die in childhood? For we would have been content with less than the station of the Muslim child.' With what can this be answered? And is it not necessary at this point except to affirm that divine matters are exalted by the decree of Majesty from being weighed with the scale of the people of Mu'tazila? And at this point, he nearly deviated and unleashed his tongue with audacity in questioning, but he was steadied by the firm statement and was called from behind the veil of the pavilions of the Presence (al-Hadrah): "He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned." Then the awe of the Presence (al-Hadrah) overwhelmed him, and he fell unconscious, trembling in his swoon. When he regained consciousness, he said: Glory be to You, how great is Your affair! I repent to You, rely on You, and believe that You are the Compelling King (al-Malik al-Jabbar), the One, the Subduer (al-Qahhar). So I fear none but You, hope for none but You, and seek refuge only in Your pardon from Your punishment and in Your pleasure from Your wrath. I have nothing except to ask You, supplicate to You, and implore before You, so I say: Expand my chest (sadr) to know You and untie a knot from my tongue to praise You. Then he was called from behind the veil: Beware of aspiring to praise and exceeding the Master of the Prophets (Sayyid al-Anbiya). Rather, return to him, for whatever he gives you, take it; whatever he forbids you from, abstain from it; and whatever he says to you, say it. For he did not increase in this Presence (al-Hadrah) beyond saying: "Glory be to You, I cannot enumerate praise upon You; You are as You have praised Yourself."

So exalted is Allah, the True King, He is not questioned about what He does, and they are questioned. And we will limit ourselves to this small amount of mentioning the wonders of the Heart (Qalb), for its exhaustive treatment is not fitting for the science of spiritual practice (Mu'amalah). Rather, we have mentioned from it what is needed for knowing the depths of the sciences of spiritual practice (Mu'amalah) and their secrets, so that those who are not satisfied with appearances and do not content themselves with the shell instead of the core (Lubab) may benefit from it, but rather yearn to know the subtleties of the realities of causes. In what we have mentioned, there is sufficiency for him and satisfaction, if Allah wills. And Allah is the Guardian of success. Completed is the book of the wonders of the Heart (Qalb), and praise and favor are to Allah. And following it is the book of disciplining the Soul (Nafs) and refining the character traits. And praise is to Allah alone, and may Allah bless every chosen servant.

a.g: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.
They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.
He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

And Allah the Exalted has described the angels, peace be upon them, with their sanctity from sins and their persistence in acts of worship (Ibadat) continuously, with being apprehensive (Mushfiqun), as He the Exalted said informing about them: "They glorify (Yasbahuna) night and day, they do not slacken, and they are from fear (Khashya) of Him apprehensive (Mushfiqun)." So when the apprehension (Ishfaq) and caution from what has preceded in the decree (Qada) in pre-eternity (Al-Azal) - and is revealed at the conclusion of the term (Ajal) - is removed, security (Amn) from the deception (Makr) of Allah prevails, and that necessitates arrogance (Kibr), and it is the cause of destruction.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
If you say: Indeed, he (peace be upon him) said after his statement to Fatimah and Safiyyah, "I cannot avail you anything from Allah except that you have kinship ties which I will maintain with due maintenance," and he (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Do you hope for Salim my intercession while the sons of Abdul-Muttalib do not hope for it?" Does that indicate that he will specifically grant his relatives intercession? Then know that every Muslim is awaiting the intercession of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and the relative is also worthy of hoping for it, but on the condition that he fears Allah (Taqwa) that He not be angry with him. For if He is angry with him, then He does not permit anyone to intercede for him, because sins are divided into that which necessitates wrath (Maaqt), so intercession is not permitted for it, and into that which is forgiven due to intercession, like sins with the kings of the world. For every person of status with the king cannot intercede in that which the king's anger has intensified against. So among sins are those from which intercession does not save, and about it is the expression by His saying, the Most High, "Nor do they intercede except for him whom He approves" (Quran 21:28), and by His saying, "Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission?" (Quran 2:255), and by His saying, "And intercession does not benefit with Him except for him whom He permits" (Quran 34:23), and by His saying, "So their intercession will not benefit them" (Quran 74:48). And when sins are divided into that in which there is intercession and into that in which there is no intercession, fear (Khawf) and apprehension (Ishfaq) become obligatory without doubt. And if there were a sin in which intercession is accepted, He would not have commanded Quraysh to obedience, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) would not have prohibited Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her) from disobedience, and he would have permitted her to follow desires to complete her self (Dhaat) in this world, then intercede for her in the Hereafter to complete her self (Dhaat) in the Hereafter.

a.g: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?
And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.
And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

And He censured those who turn away from them, saying: 'And We made the sky a protected ceiling, and they are turning away from its signs.' ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
And the differing composition of its limbs are wonders that increase over wonders in its resurrection and restoration, so how can one deny that from the power (Qudrah) of Allah the Exalted and His wisdom who witnesses that in His creation and power? If there is weakness in your faith (Iman), then strengthen the faith (Iman) by looking at the first creation, for the second is like it and easier than it. And if you are strong in faith (Iman) in it, then make your heart (Qalb) feel those fears and dangers, and increase in it reflection (Tafakkur) and consideration (I'tibar) to strip from your heart (Qalb) comfort and settlement, so you busy yourself with preparing for the presentation before the Almighty (Al-Jabbar). And reflect first on what strikes the hearing of the inhabitants of the graves from the intensity of blowing the Trumpet (As-Sur), for it is a single cry by which the graves split open from the heads of the dead, and they rise up all at once. So imagine yourself having leapt up, your face changed, your body dusty from your scalp to your feet from the dust of your grave, stunned from the intensity of the blow, your eye fixed toward the call. And the creation has risen up in one uprising from the graves in which their tribulation has been prolonged, and alarm and terror have agitated them, added to what they had of sorrows and griefs and intense waiting for the outcome of the matter, as the Exalted said: 'And the Trumpet (As-Sur) will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.' And the Exalted said: 'And when the Horn (An-Naqur) is blown, that Day will be a difficult day for the disbelievers; not easy.' And the Exalted said: 'And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?" They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing. And they will not be able to make a testament, nor to their people can they return. And the Trumpet (As-Sur) will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten. They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us from our sleeping place? This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."' So if there were not before the dead except the terror of that blowing, it would be worthy to be feared, for it is a blowing and a cry by which those in the heavens and the earth are struck dead, meaning they die by it except whom Allah wills, and that is some of the angels. And therefore the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'How can I be at ease when the possessor of the Trumpet (As-Sur) has taken the horn in his mouth, lowered his forehead, and inclined his ear, waiting for when he is commanded to blow?' Maqatil said: The Trumpet (As-Sur) is the horn, and that Israfil (upon him be peace) is placing his mouth on the horn like the form of a trumpet, and the circle of the horn's head is like the width of the heavens and the earth, and he is fixing his gaze toward the Throne, waiting for when he is commanded to blow the first blowing. And when he blows, those in the heavens and the earth are struck dead, meaning every animal dies from the intensity of the alarm except whom Allah wills, and that is Jibril, Mika'il, Israfil, and the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt). Then the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt) is commanded to take the soul (Ruh) of Jibril, then the soul (Ruh) of Mika'il, then the soul (Ruh) of Israfil, then the Angel of Death (Malak al-Mawt) is commanded and he dies. Then the creation remains after the first blowing in the Barzakh for forty years, then Allah the Exalted revives Israfil and commands.

a.g: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...
Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.
And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.
Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?
Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
The Fourth Foundation: The Balance (Mizan) is truth. Allah the Exalted said: 'And We will set up the balances of justice (al-Mawazin al-Qist) for the Day of Resurrection' (Surah Al-Anbiya: 47). And He said: 'Then as for those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful ones. And as for those whose scales are light' (Surah Al-Muminun: 102-103). And its interpretation (Wajhuha) is that Allah the Exalted creates in the scrolls of deeds a weight (Waznan) according to the degrees of deeds with Allah the Exalted, so the measures (Maqadir) of the deeds of the servants become known to the servants until justice (al-Adl) in punishment or favor (al-Fadl) in pardon and multiplication of reward becomes apparent to them.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
The thoughts (Khawatir) of His servants when they stirâ€”He from Whose knowledge not an atom's weight in the heavens or earth escapes, whether it moves or is stillâ€”the Accountant (Al-Muhasib) over the smallest and the largest of deeds, even if hidden; the Bestower of favor (Al-Mutafaddil) by accepting the acts of obedience (Taat) of the servants, even if small; the One who extends pardon (Al-Mutawwil) by forgiving their sins, even if numerous. And He only accounts them so that every soul (Nafs) may know what it has brought forth and reflect on what it has sent ahead and left behind, so it knows that were it not for its adherence to vigilance (Muraqabah) and self-accounting (Muhasabah) in this world, it would be exposed on the plain of Resurrection and perish. And after striving (Mujahadah), self-accounting, and vigilance, were it not for His grace (Fadl) in accepting their meager offering, it would fail and lose. So glory be to Him whose favor (Nimat) encompasses all servants, and whose mercy (Rahmah) embraces and pervades the creatures in this world and the next, and overwhelms. And by the breaths of His grace, the hearts (Qulub) expanded for faith (Iman) and were opened, and by the blessing of His enabling success (Tawfiq), the limbs (Jawarih) were bound to acts of worship (Ibadat) and disciplined, and by the excellence of His guidance (Hidayah), the darknesses of ignorance (Jahl) cleared from the hearts and dispersed, and by His support (Tayid) and victory (Nasr), the schemes of Satan (Shaytan) were cut off and repelled, and by the gentleness of His care (Inayah), the scale of good deeds (Hasanat) tips when heavy, and by His facilitation (Taysir), what is facilitated of acts of obedience is facilitated. From Him is the giving and the recompense, the distancing and the drawing near, the making happy and the making wretched. And prayers and peace be upon Muhammad, the master of the prophets, and upon his family, the masters of the chosen ones, and upon his companions, the leaders of the pious. Then after, Allah the Exalted said: 'And We will set up the scales of justice (Al-Mawazin Al-Qist) for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed (Habbah min Khardal), We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant (Hasib).' And He said: 'And the record [of deeds] will be placed, and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.' And He said: 'On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah has enumerated it, and they have forgotten it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.' And He said: 'That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown their deeds. So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it, and whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.' And He said: 'Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.' And He said: 'On the Day when every soul will find what it did of good present [before it] and what it did of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allah warns you of Himself.' And He said: 'And know that Allah knows what is within yourselves, so beware of Him.' So the possessors of insight (Arbab Al-Basair) from among the servants recognized that Allah the Exalted is lying in wait for them and that they will be scrutinized in the account and demanded with atom's weights of thoughts (Khawatir) and glances (Lahzat). And they realized that nothing saves them from these dangers except adherence to self-accounting, sincerity in vigilance, and demanding accountability from the soul (Nafs) in breaths (Anfas) and movements (Harakat), and accounting it for thoughts and glances. For whoever accounts his soul before being accounted, his account on the Day of Resurrection will be lightened, his answer will be present at the questioning, and his outcome and return will be good. And whoever does not account his soul, it persists.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And as for the Guidance (Rushd), we mean by it the Divine Care (Al-'Inayah Al-Ilahiyyah) that assists the human when he turns toward his objectives, so it guides him to what contains his rectification (Salah) and turns him away from what contains his corruption (Fasad), and this is from the inner dimension (Al-Batin) as Allah the Exalted said: 'And verily We gave Abraham his Guidance (Rushd) from before, and We were of him Knowers.' So the Guidance (Rushd) is an expression for a guidance (Hidayah) that motivates toward the direction of happiness (Al-Sa'adah) and moves toward it. For the boy when he reaches puberty, knowledgeable about preserving wealth and ways of commerce and growth, but with that he squanders and does not desire growth, he is not called guided (Rashid), not due to absence of his guidance (Hidayah) but due to deficiency of his guidance (Hidayah) in moving his motivation (Da'iyah). For how many a person proceeds upon what he knows harms him, he has been given the guidance (Hidayah) and distinguished by it from the ignorant one who does not know that it harms him, but he has not been given the Guidance (Rushd). So the Guidance (Rushd) by this consideration is more complete than mere guidance (Hidayah) to the aspects of deeds, and it is a great blessing (Ni'mah).

a.g: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."
He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."
They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"
He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.
And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."
So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].
They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."
They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

ğŸ“– Vol 2: Enjoining Good and Forbidding Evil
The fourth degree: reviling and rebuking with harsh, coarse speech, and one resorts to this when incapable of prevention with gentleness and when signs of persistence and mockery of admonition and counsel appear. This is like the saying of Abraham (peace be upon him): 'Uff (an expression of disgust) to you and to what you worship besides Allah. Do you not then understand?' And we do not mean by reviling and obscenity that which involves attribution to fornication and its preliminaries, nor lying, but rather addressing him with what is not considered among obscenities, such as saying: 'O transgressor (Fasiq), O fool (Ahmaq), O ignorant one (Jahil), do you not fear Allah?' and like saying: 'O black one (Sawadi), O stupid one (Ghabi),' and what runs in this course. For every transgressor (Fasiq) is a fool (Ahmaq) and ignorant (Jahil), and were it not for his foolishness (Hamaq), he would not disobey Allah Almighty. Rather, everyone who is not prudent (Kays) is a fool (Ahmaq), and the prudent one (Kays) is he whom the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) testified to for prudence (Kaysah) when he said: 'The prudent one (Kays) is he who holds his Soul (Nafs) accountable and works for what is after death,' and the fool (Ahmaq) is he who follows his Soul's (Nafs) desire (Hawa) and wishes upon Allah. The hadith: 'The prudent one (Kays) is he who holds his Soul (Nafs) accountable and works for what is after death'â€”the hadith was reported by Al-Tirmidhi who said it is hasan, and by Ibn Majah from the narration of Shaddad ibn Aws. For this rank, there are two etiquettes: one is not to proceed to it except out of necessity and incapacity for gentleness, and the second is not to speak except with truth and not to indulge in it by letting his long tongue loose with what is not needed, but rather to limit to the extent of need. If he knows that addressing him with these deterrent words does not deter him, then it is not appropriate to let it loose, but rather to limit to showing anger and contempt for him and disdain for his place due to his disobedience. And if he knows that if he speaks he will be struck, but if he frowns and shows dislike with his face he will not be struck, it is incumbent upon him, and it does not suffice him to disapprove with the Heart (Qalb), but rather it is incumbent upon him.

a.g: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.
And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.
And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.
And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.
And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.
And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.
And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Etiquette of Quran Recitation
And Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) said regarding His (the Exalted's) statement: 'And whoever is given wisdom has been given much good' (Quran 2:269) - meaning understanding (Fahm) in the Quran. And He (the Exalted) said: 'So We gave Solomon understanding (Fahhamnaha) of it, and to each We gave judgment (Hukm) and knowledge (Ilm)' (Quran 21:79). He named what He gave both of them as knowledge (Ilm) and judgment (Hukm), and He specified what Solomon uniquely possessed of discernment (Tafattun) by the name 'understanding' (Fahm) and made it precede judgment (Hukm) and knowledge (Ilm). These matters indicate that in understanding (Fahm) the meanings of the Quran there is a vast and extensive scope, and that what is transmitted of the apparent interpretation (Tafsir) is not the ultimate limit of comprehension (Idrak) in it.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Book of Knowledge
And Al-Shafi'i, may Allah have mercy upon him, said: 'Empowerment (Tamkin) is the rank of the Prophets, and empowerment does not occur except after trial (Mihna). So when one is tested, he endures with patience (Sabr), and when he endures with patience, he is empowered. Do you not see that Allah, the Exalted and Majestic, tested Ibrahim, peace be upon him, then empowered him; and tested Musa, peace be upon him, then empowered him; and tested Ayyub, peace be upon him, then empowered him; and tested Sulayman, peace be upon him, then empowered him and granted him a kingdom. And empowerment is the best of ranks. Allah, the Exalted and Majestic, said: "And thus We empowered Yusuf in the land" (Yusuf: 56). And Ayyub, peace be upon him, after the great trial, was empowered. Allah, the Exalted, said: "And We gave him his family and the like of them with them" (Al-Anbiya': 84) the verse. This speech from Al-Shafi'i, may Allah have mercy upon him, indicates his deep immersion in the secrets of the Quran and his awareness of the stations (Maqamat) of those journeying (Sa'irin) to Allah, the Exalted, from among the Prophets and the Friends (Awliya'), and all of that is from the sciences of the Hereafter (Al-Akhira).'

a.g: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.
And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."
So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.
And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Invocations and Supplications
Sixth: Supplication (Tadarru'), Humility (Khushu'), Desire (Raghba), and Fear (Rahba). Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed they used to hasten to good deeds and call upon Us with desire and fear' (Quran 21:90). And He the Mighty and Majestic said: 'Call upon your Lord with supplication and in secret' (Quran 7:55). And the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'When Allah loves a servant, He tests him until He hears his supplication.'

a.g: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.
So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.
And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return
Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Foundations of Belief
The fear of the ending (Al-Khatimah) is like the fear of the precedent (As-Sabiqah), and perhaps what appears in the present moment contradicts what the word (Al-Kalimah) preceded. So who knows that he is from those for whom the good (Al-Husna) has preceded from Allah? And it was said regarding the meaning of His saying, the Exalted: 'And the agony of death (Sakrat Al-Mawt) comes with the truth (Al-Haqq)' - meaning with the precedent (As-Sabiqah), that is, it reveals it. And some of the predecessors (As-Salaf) said: 'Only the endings (Al-Khawatim) of deeds are weighed.' And Abu Ad-Darda', may Allah be pleased with him, would swear by Allah that no one feels secure from having his faith (Iman) stripped away except that it is stripped from him. And it was said: Among sins (Adh-Dhunub) are sins whose punishment is a bad ending (Su' Al-Khatimah) - we seek refuge in Allah from that. And it was said: They are punishments for claiming sainthood (Al-Wilayah) and honor (Al-Karamah) through falsehood.

a.g: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.
Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"
But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.
Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.
And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."
[The Prophet] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."
